The syringe's more subtle side-effects of mind warping in full effect, the enormous blob of a hedgehog gave an enthusiastic "Heck no!".

However to say he was merely a blob would be giving a disservice to his now rather... defined features, to say the least. Eight tons of sweating, blue furry flab, just about every part on Sonic's once slim and taut body was grossly exaggerated to a comical extent. Over a dozen times the size of his original size, his stomach sat out a good metre from himself, quivering and shaking like a bowel of jelly with even the slightest provocation. Resting either side on top and to his sides were his arms and legs, almost entirely submerged in a thick ring of blubber which stopped Sonic from doing much more than wiggle his largely obscured feet and sausage-like fingers. You could be excused for missing these features however, given how he now sported a chest which would put Rouge's to shame, each male boob the size of a deflated yoga-mall sagging to the sides of his stomach. The crowning part of this gargantuan hedgehog however were the two miniature mountains he now uncharacteristically called his butt cheeks, their size dwarfing the rest of his body as his bloated head leaned contently back into them.

"Sheesh, why would I want to get rid of all this doc?" Sonic asked with a noticeably lower voice, seemingly unaware it was himself who'd waddled in a few hours earlier, barely mobile and desperately begging for medical attention. "How'd I even get in here, I think it's been a few minutes since I ate something!"

Flabbergasted at the once speedy character's sudden acceptance of his incredible bulk, the doctor found himself in a bind. On one hand, the subject was obviously delirious. On the other hand, he was rather bluntly denying his services, and holding the hedgeblob here against his will would be tough to justify if Sonic was far too immobile to prove he was a risk to himself or others. Not to mention all Mobian medical science would've told you what was sitting before him was physically impossible, and that the patient in front of him should've keeled over and died from that amount of blubber on that small a subject before he even reached the medical labs.

Sighing awkwardly, the doctor shrugged and found himself inable to administer the closest thing they had to an antidote.

"Well, do you have any family or friends who can ship you off- I mean, pick you up and take you home, Mr. The Hedgehog?"

Thinking to himself for a moment (inbetween the near-constant euphoric thoughts of eating), Sonic answered...

11221121.content:
It had not been an easy afternoon for Knuckles. The echidna had been running himself ragged. He had hoped to be left to his own devices following the collapse of the Machine Empire and the routing of Doctor Robotnik. He had been holding his breath for Victory Day, when the free peoples of Mobius would break out the champagne. Not a moment had passed following Robotnik's retreat before Knuckles found himself being called away from the battle. Something strange had befallen General Fairfax. The once energetic, dynamic commander of the Dalmont 23rd Infantry had swollen into a huge, indolent mass of flesh, all thoughts of battle plans and strategies lost in a never-ending hunger. Knuckles had nearly despaired, but had managed to rally the Staff Officers and the NCO's single-handedly, and had already issued instructions for Fairfax to be escorted where his new-found gluttony would not be detrimental, all the while making sure that the convoy carried enough fruits and vegetables to help him through the trip.

Mere moments later, he was summoned to the Principality of Soleanna to try and help Elise, who only a week ago, had worked herself to the bone to mobilise her army. He sighed at the sight; Elise was nigh-unrecognisable, a huge mountain of human fat billowing and bulging out in all directions. He could only repeat the instructions to her servants and ladies-in-waiting and hope that the Princess's hunger would only be temporary. Within an hour, he received a summons demanding his aid in assisting no fewer than seventeen individuals, all of them scattered about the continent, all of them prominent military or political figures, all of them fattened to an impossible degree, all of them losing their intellect in a vast, bottomless stupor. This had all the makings of a ploy from Robotnik. It made perfect sense:- infect every public figure, force them into indolence, resulting in a withdrawal or consolidation of resources and soldiers, allowing time for Robotnik to retreat, regroup, replan and rebuild. Now, all Knuckles had wanted was to find someone who had not been suddenly struck by this insane malaise.

His hopes were dashed at the sight of his old friend and comrade, Sonic. Once a lightning fast beacon of hope, now he had been swollen into a vast, rounded giant of a hedgehog. Knuckles could barely see Sonic's legs, wide as they were, behind that massive, pendulous gut. He saw huge, bloated arms hang loosely from the shoulders, the spherical upper arms almost obscured by the large, doughy man-breasts that sat on the hedgehog's stomach. His face had become almost spherical, multiple chins wobbling and jiggling with each breath. His eyes stared lazily in Knuckles's direction, all life in them gone.

"Hey there Knuckles! Looking pretty good there..." Sonic finally chuckled. Before long, a large belch echoed from the hedgehog's mouth as he rubbed at his stomach.

Knuckles could only sigh. "You've been infected too? This thing is getting huge..." Already, the weight of this news was bringing down further than the day's fatigue could.

"Uh-huh," Sonic nodded, "You look good with a belly. I thought I'd be the only slob here."

Knuckles looked up, ready to retort that his stomach was perfectly lean and not at all like the massive belly bouncing and shaking in front of him. No sooner had he opened his mouth -

"I was going to make four Triple Giga Deluxe orders. Should I order eight, now you're here?"

Knuckles froze. What was going on?

"Hey, Knuckles? You hungry? You're pretty quiet."

Knuckles watched, puzzled. Did Sonic actually think he had become infected as well? Could he only see a huge, fat slob like himself standing before him? Would everyone in Mobius look like a slob in the lazy eyes that Sonic now had?

Knuckles had to reach a decision. Already, Sonic's brow became furrowed with suspicion.

Knuckles shrugged. It was time to get into character. "*Urrrrrrrp!* Though I guess it doesn't matter, I'm finding this sorta-" the echidna said in-between some heavy breathing. He paused for a second, trying to find a way to further convince Sonic of his new-found state. Knuckles had forgotten entirely about the Master Emerald! The war had pulled him away from his duty; could something have happened to it? He sighed.

One problem at a time.

"I, eh... Well, it was really hard guarding that emerald all the time and... Oh damn it Sonic, I came down here to stuff my face with as much greasy junk food as I could! There, you happy?" Knuckles smirked. Suddenly, his chances of acquiring that cure had been imbued. Well, he thought, now onto step two. "*URP!* Oh, so you see this all as a game, huh?" he boasted.

"Would I ever see it as anything else? I'll choose the venue and we can pig out to our hearts content... Don't feel bad if you can't eat everything, I'll be perfectly fine just eating anything you can't!"

Suddenly, Sonic waddled up towards Knuckles; it was all the echidna could do to stand on the spot and hope that his stomach did not get into contact with Sonic's massive belly apron. 112211211122.content:
Sonic stared at Knuckles for a long time. Confusion and suspicion were starting to slowly rise beneath the dull haze his brain languished in. He looked at his friend. By all appearances, Knuckles was every bit as fat and doughy as he was. His belly was a massive globe of flesh puckered by a deep, dark navel, the dome smeared with all sorts of grease, sauces and discarded crumbs. His neck was hidden by huge, puffy cheeks that partially hid his eyes and chins that wobbled with each word spoken, and a drooping, bulging chest rested lazily on the red giant's gut. His arms, almost spherical with fat, slumped down the bulging, sloping sides of the echidna's ballooned waist. His nigh-conical legs held up that massive weight. In short, Knuckles looked no thinner than Sonic did!

But even so, there were questions that even Sonic could not put his finger on.

First, why did it sound like Knuckles was talking from his stomach? The echidna's lips were synchronised perfectly with what was being said, but the sound did not come from there. Whenever Sonic looked his friend in the face, he would always be drawn away from it and instead be pulled to face the source of his voice. Which was his stomach, apparently. Also, why did Knuckles sound like he did? He had always known his friend's deep baritone voice, but, for some reason, he continued to speak in the same voice he had always heard Knuckles use when the two were thin. How was it that Knuckles had been able to speak as clearly as ever? His own voice, thanks to his laboured breathing and puffy cheeks, was far raspier, thicker and deeper, to the point where even he could tell the difference! Knuckles's voice, on the other hand... A twinge of jealousy passed over Sonic's eyes. Why couldn't he be as well spoken as his friend was? What denied him, Sonic, that right? And why was Knuckles able to control his bodily functions so easily?! It was not as if Sonic felt the need to undertake the effort, but how was his friend able to master his new body better than he could?! The unfairness galled him.

It also did not make sense how Sonic was unable to touch him. Just now, he tried to reach a pudgy, grease-stained finger towards his friend and just sample what he had been eating that had made him so big. He moved so close to Knuckles that it would only make sense for their massive bellies to collide with each other. They didn't. They never even touched. Sonic never felt any resistance upon his stomach. It was if Knuckles was a hologram, and he had passed right through him!

And why was Knuckles sounding so urgent? He was talking at a speed that completely contradicted his slobby status. All of those questions, and at such speed, made Sonic's head spin! Knuckles had sounded far too energetic, too animated, too... dynamic to be a slob, and he never seemed to need to breathe nearly as heavily for someone of his apparent size. And why was he whining about it all being part of a great, big conspiracy? What did Robotnik even do to him?! He would have known if the Doctor had done something. Couldn't Knuckles just take it down a notch?!

Sonic felt anger, humiliation and betrayal at the conclusion he finally reached. Knuckles had never converted to slobdom, and, in fact, had been lying to him the whole time! Was he mocking him the whole time?! Was he enjoying the thought of outwitting him? Was he going to run away on his little, nimble legs and gloat to his little, nimble friends about the day he played Sonic like a teddy bear?!

Sonic glared down at his friend. His tiny, minuscule, pompous, weak, fragile friend would be welcomed into the fold.

He grinned a mirthless shark's grin.

He lunged.

He only then remembered, as Knuckles easily stepped aside and his massive, heaving body sailed beyond all control through the air, that grabbing him in his current state would be like swatting a particularly agile and irritating fly.

He landed heavily on the floor, his huge apron of a gut cushioning his fall, and his momentum sent him skidding across the surface until his head collided with the wall. Stars danced about his vision, until he felt something move on his back, just behind his right shoulder. It was lighter than he would be, but it was certainly heavy enough to give him discomfort. He tried to look up, his weight and the many folds of flesh that enveloped his body restricting his movement and vision. He tried to reach up, his arms lazily swatting at the air, his fat legs kicking at the ground. He fidgeted and shuffled on his belly, trying to reach the annoyance, trying to roll over and crush him, trying to... trying... to... trying...

He slumped, his doughy arms and conical legs splayed out, and he lay still, his breath issuing from his mouth in deep, defeated sighs. He felt sweat trickle down his face in rivulets to the floor. The weight upon his back shifted and he winced as he felt and heard a hissing voice at his right ear.

"I am sorry, Sonic," he heard Knuckles say, "I am sorry that this has happened to you, and I am sorry I had to do this. You'll thank me later."

He heard a rustling behind him, as of someone searching through a backpack. He heard the snap of an opening case.

He felt a sharp sting on his shoulder.

He was too tired to do more than moan softly as the syringe took his blood sample. His efforts to subdue Knuckles had winded him more than he anticipated.

He felt the pressure on his right shoulder lift, and heard the slap of boots against the floor. He heard Knuckles call out as he opened the door.

"Just sit tight, Sonic! I'll come back and fix this as soon as I can!"

The door closed behind him, and the only sound left in the room was Sonic's breathing. When the big, blue hedgehog finally rolled onto his back, Knuckles had vanished.

Tails decided to change course and investigate. "It may not be friendly, but they need help!" He said, knowing that Sonic and the other Freedom Fighters wouldn't back down, so neither would he.

Tails eventually managed to reach the dome covered city and observed it from the air. "The glass is hard to see through... but it doesn't look bad..." He started talking himself out of investigating. "No! They sent that Distress Call for a reason. I need to go down and check." Tails piloted the plane closer to the ground and looked for an entrance to land by. However all of the normal entrances were completely sealed off, with no guards surrounding the outside. This did strike him as odd. Who was keeping them prisoners in the dome? If he couldn't investigate from above. He'd have to enter from below.

Activating some switches on the Tornado, Tails made it shift from its normal plane mode, to that of a drill. A very recent addition he might add... Having timed the morph perfectly, he collided with the ground and burrowed underneath several yards, then began making his way upward through the glass, until he broke through the ground.

Tails was hardly out of the plane before he was gagging. The smell that permeated the air smelled like rotten eggs and skunks. He got out and fumbled around trying to get away from the scent... wherever it was coming from, but there was no escaping it. The entire dome reaked.

Before he could do anything, several of the inhabitants approached him. His entrance wasn't exactly quiet. "What are... *Urp* You doing here?!" One of the portly members stated. Tails could see that all of them were all a varying degree of overweight, and their clothes were stained with grunge. Not something the inhabitants used to be known for. "I heard the Distress Call on the radio... *Cough* and I came to help." Tails answered them, trying to stay focused over the smell.

Tails froze. The Static in the Radio completely cut out the parts that could have mentioned the quarantine, and now he was smack dab in the middle of it.... Whatever it was. "Uh... Hey... Let me.... see if there's anything I can do..." Tails offered nervously, now fearing for his own safety here.

141.content:
Waking up to the first day in what would hopefully be a successful break from chasing the man of her dreams, Amy went about her normal morning routine. Watering her household plants, having a shower, brushing her quills and changing into her favorite red dress and boots, and finally, a light breakfast of grapefruit and water and a slice of plain bread slightly toasted. Her favorite way to start the day.

Or at least she'd been telling herself that for who knows how many years. Chasing Sonic was hard work; if no less then 3 different hedgehogs, an overweight scientist with his own empire, the same overweight scientist's from an alternate dimension, the G.U.N. and various god-like creatures couldn't keep up with him, what hope did she have? A good diet, that's what. With hardly any extra weight to hold back the hedgehog down she found herself running into him more often then not, and surely depriving herself of the majority food the world had on offer was worth the reward of getting to talk to Sonic for 2 minutes every couple months, right?

Yet whether she had contemplated this or not is irrelevant; as she in fact didn't have anything that morning; her fridge and pantry was completely empty, nary a crumb was left; mostly because she hardly stocked in anything in the first place. Not that much of a problem. Until she realized that she lived miles away from a supermarket, and skipping the day's most important meal on her first day of 'Sonic Rehab' would surely put her metabolism out of whack, not to mention her sense of relaxation. Panicking despite possibly exaggerating the situation, she quickly pulled out a dusty old phone book and frantically eyed through dozens of numbers, trying to make out if there was any delivery restaurant that specialized in grapefruit for people on strict diets. Coming to her wits end as her stomach started to gurgle, she phoned the first number that was associated with breakfast, quickly blurting everything out in one breath before hanging up.

"HII'MAMYROSEANDIREALLYNEEDAMEALCANYOUGIVEMEYOURMOSTHEALTHYBREAKFAST MEALANDQUICKLYI'MONADIETYOUSEEI'MATAPARTMENT16ROOM3ONGREENGROOVESTOKTHAN KSBYE!"

She sighed in relief, turning on the television and plonking herself down on her couch as she wondered whether she'd be lucky enough to get two whole grapefruits from where she'd ordered her breakfast. She froze when she realized one small detail she hadn't bothered to check; the name of the restaurant she'd phoned. And then relaxed, figuring that in today's day and age, even the dodgiest of fast-food establishments had some sort of 'healthy' alternative. Not that she'd know, mind you, and when she finally opened the door to her delivery, she froze again, this time not unfreezing until the team of delivery men had finished unloading what looked like several towering piles of some of the most unbelievably greasy food Amy had ever seen. Everything was so deep-fried even the bowels seemed like an over-zealous and underpaid chef had assumed whoever was on the receiving end wouldn't tell the difference. That's not even starting on the water-tank sized bottle of cola, a tap on the side added for convenient access, or the dozens of onion rings, incidentally just as large as the one's Amy normally wound up collecting here and there.

After clicking his fingers in front of her, the leader of the team got Amy's attention. Most of it anyway."Let'see her miss... 15 Skyscraper Burgers, smothered in a thick layer of fat with whipped cream on top, 25 bowels of Spinning Onion Rings, 3 Wedding Cakes with BBQ and Bacon filling, a Bubblegum and Peanut Butter Iceberg-sized Frosted Shake, 100L Cola from our own brewery... Yep, all of it seems in order! We'll check back in a week to see if you've met the requirements ma'am-"

"WAIT- Wait, sorry. Eh, I think you have the wrong apartment."

"That'd be a first miss; Bob here has mighty fine hearing when it comes to taking calls. This is Room 3, of Apartment 16, of Green Grove St, Central City, is it not?"

Amy's heart nearly missed a beat as it started to dawn on her where this was heading. "Eh... Yes, but-" "Well, we here at Scales Buster's Breakfast," Amy's hear DID miss a beat here once she finally heard the mystery joint's name. She was right about it having 'Breakfast' in it's name, yet that didn't change the fact that it was apparent that this 3rd-rate company's idea of what the 'healthiest meal on a menu' would clog an entire army's arteries in a hear beat. "Have to go through a lot of effort preparing the meals for those who want to take the 'Un-healthiest Meal Challenge', and from I hear you were mighty eager over the phone to sign up into our little promotion."

"... 'Un-healthiest Meal Challenge'? You've got to be kidding... Ugh, look... Would it be a hassle to just... Take everything back? My entire apartment's filled with outrageously-themed junk food and it kind of mucks up the color-scheme I had laid out-" "Well... I guess we can! Though it's not like we'll find another participant right away... This contest has been a bit unpopular for us. Though I guess if you're not satisfied, we'll take everything back. That'll be 50." "*Phew* No really, it's okay- ... 50? 50 what? 50 bucks?! I'm not getting refunded!?! But this isn't what I ordered! ... Okay, it was technically, but it's not what I meant when I ordered!" The main delivery man chuckled. "Oh my no, not 50 bucks; 50 grand! This stuff isn't cheap to make and to throw it out for nothing..." Amy quickly went from freaking out to getting angry. "So!? What do you expect me to do! Heck, I'm BROKE! Screw this bunch of crummy food-" "It's actually pretty tasty once you get past the first couple mouthfuls~" a younger delivery boy piped in "-Shut up, I don't care!" Again the delivery man chuckled, though perhaps a bit more cautiously then before due to Amy's extreme temperament. And her Piko Piko hammer she was starting to hold. That too.

"Look ma'am, we said at the begining this is a promotion; you don't pay for it if you keep it- assuming you eat it all within the week of course. You win our grand mystery prize, plus don't have to pay a cent for this excellent gourmet meal, thank you very much. If you lose, which means you didn't finish everything, you have to pay for what you didn't finish. But you get the benefit having eaten everything before it! Or you can just redo the competition, but that leaves you with more to eat... Personally you seem kinda shrimp-ish but with a loud mouth like that you could prove me wrong-"

Amy dropped the hammer and started to sulk. "Ugh... I'm really cornered in this stupid thing, aren't I? All these burgers, rings, the weird bacon cake thing... " "Oh, we forgot the Chili Dogs... Thought this seemed a bit too small. Bob! Bring in those crates!" Within a few more moments, Amy's apartment was also filled with what seemed like several hundred foot long hot dogs smothered in chili, topped with cheese, smothered in more chili... Actually everyone it went just as high as it was long in toppings... "Ugh... Just go... Man, I'm going to be a blimp by Wednesday."

After they left Amy viewed the site around her, not knowing whether to cry or yell. There was absolutely nothing she could do about it; except eat. It wasn't until she heard a large gurgle emit from her flat stomach and, looking down at it, realized she was still hungry from not having breakfast. "May as well try one of those onion rings..." Grabbing a ring with her glove, already feeling the grease dampen her gloves as she clenched around the thick exterior, she took a bite. Savoring it in her mouth, she suddenly realized this was the first time she'd had any junk food in a long time. Maybe even the first time. By the time she'd thought of this she'd already finished the first ring and was chomping on another. By the time she realized she actually kind of dug the taste of the onion rings at least, she was head down devouring everything in a hunger-fueled eating rampage in the first of many, many bowels she was expected to chow down within a weeks time.

Maybe this situation wasn't so bad after all.

1531222211222111111221221221112221121121.content:
Silver stared long and hard at the tubers, each of them slowly pulsating. He felt his bile rise up through his throat. His forearms quivered. To think that these six vegetables would bring about the downhill slide of civilisation, it was all he could do not to lose control and give his position away. These were not natural. Someone had created these with a purpose in mind, but who would gain anything from turning Mobius into a dreary gas giant populated by slobs? None of history's dictators seemed to match the motive.

It didn't matter. It had to end, and it would end here, and now, by his hand.

His hand that he raised to atomise the vegetables.

Hold.

He paused. Did one of those things... talk to him?

We mean you no harm, Mobian. We mean no-one any harm. We only wish to bring you to Grandfather's embrace.

He blinked, gaping at the vegetables until he finally found his voice.

"Who are you?! What do you want?!"

We are Grandfather's heralds. We are His eyes and ears and hands. We enact His will. Our wish is His wish, and it is His wish that Mobius return to the fold.

Silver panicked. "Return to the fold?! What are you talking about?!"

This world was one of a million that lived under Grandfather's benevolence. He protected those worlds from pain, from suffering, from doubt. When the Cataclysm struck, Grandfather was swept away in a tide of fire. All the worlds that He loved, that He cared for, fell from His gaze. History eroded all evidence of His existence, save for a temple or a chapel on half a dozen planets. The young races built their cities over the ancient sites, and they forgot. Do you not understand, Silver of Mobius? They... you... lost your way. But Grandfather is forgiving. He is reaching out to us again. The worlds will be His to love and nurture again.

"Why?" Silver screamed, "Why does your Grandfather care about all of that?!"

He loves us, Silver, and He loves you. You could bring about His return. You could be Grandfather's voice, for the rest of Mobius. Join us, and we can restore utopia. We can-

"Save it!" Silver spat at the vegetables, "'We can create Eden'? Is that what you were going to say? End wars, perhaps? End hunger? Innocent happy stupor, is that what you were going to call it?! Well, I got news for you and your grandpa!"

He raised his hands and pushed them forward in the direction of the tubers, the palms glowing.

"I've heard it before, and I am not buying it. Not after what you did to Blaze!"

He focussed all of his energy into obliterating the vegetables. His eyes were scrunched up so tight, he could not see what was happening. But he could feel their resistance, their determination to hold their structure together even as he tried to pull them apart into atoms. Every fibre of his being shook. His teeth clenched tightly together. His fingers were quivering beyond all control.

There! He felt it. They began to give way. He could feel their structure fall apart. Each tuber was slowly torn to pieces by his psychic might. First, they became wedges, then shreds, then dust, then atoms, then...

Silver fell to his knees. He could no longer hear that voice as it pleaded with him, begging him to stop. He could no longer see them, or feel their presence.

Had he done it?

He wasn't sure.

It didn't matter, he thought, as he fell onto his face and into unconsciousness.

He did not know how long he was asleep before he felt something nudge his ribs.

"Up and at 'em, Silver!"

He tried to roll onto his back, but a firm hand caught his upper arm.

"Unless you want to fall off my house, I'd be very careful, if I were you," Vanilla chuckled. With that, she gently helped the psyker onto his feet, where, shaking his head and rubbing his brow, he finally opened his eyes to see the familiar slender figure of Vanilla the Rabbit. Behind her was Rouge, her wings keeping her aloft.

"Vanilla!" Silver blurted out, "Are you OK?" The rabbit's eyebrow raised.

"Am I OK? I assure you, I wasn't the one who collapsed on my roof," she smiled before rolling her eyes. "Yes. Yes, I am fine."

"What was going on, Silver?" Rouge spoke up. "I was about to investigate a temple, when I detected a powerful telekinetic burst. What were you doing up here?"

Silver gaped. A temple?!

Wide enough for even the most immobile slobs to be carried inside, Silver thought bitterly. He peered inside, unable to see far into the darkness. He could smell the mustiness of an ancient tomb, but beneath was another aroma, a more worryingly familiar one.

He didn't want to believe it, and he could not recall any records of an ancient cult dedicated to slobdom. All of this made him ponder - who else lived on Mobius? Who dedicated their lives to this entity? Were they actively seeking slobdom? Did they want the mindless, happy stupor the tubers were promising?

Shaking his head, Silver began making a tentative foot forward. He felt it land on a stone surface with a gentle tap.

He waited.

1531222211222111111221221221112221121121.content:
Silver watched as the Sanctum began appearing to shrink before his eyes. He watched as his belly rolled outward and forward, his thoughts about his own figure long gone. He smiled sadly as his ballooning legs gave out beneath him; he saved the past. He ensured the future was secured and protected, just as he had set out to do. He chuckled to himself; he hadn't imagined it would end any way like this, growing and fattening into immobility, his silver and white fur becoming a murky green. After what he had seen Blaze succumb to, nothing had fazed him anymore. Mere months ago, he would have been alarmed to the point of paralysis at the thought of gaining such weight. Now, he barely raised an eyebrow. He barely paid mention to the loss of any mobility in his legs. It scarcely bothered him when his arms became vast, fleshy cones tipped with inflated palms and fingers. He didn't even notice the dark green pyramid of three circles that had begun to emerge along his stomach.

Silver's smile dropped as he thought of the others. It was better that they never see him. It would be too much to hope for that the old man's word could be taken at face value. It seemed too convenient that he would leave Mobius alone if Silver had chosen as he did.

Here was how he saved the world from Grandfather. There was no death-defying ploy, no glorious, climactic battle between gods and mortals. There was only Silver, sitting alone in a dimly-lit chamber in a forgotten ruin. There was only Silver, growing larger and fatter than he imagined was ever possible. There was only Silver, who watched lazily as his arms and legs lost all mobility. It had become an effort in and of itself to turn his head, his swelling and multiplying chins lifting his growing, spherical face until his gaze rested on the ceiling. He looked up, his eyes barely squinting up behind his puffy, inflated cheeks at the patterns above him. He did not know what psychic power he had left to him. He could lift himself up from the ground, but where would he go? He could shift the blocks, but what would he gain from it? It would only expose him, show himself to the others, such as he was. It would upset them, and only make things worse. It could even infect them as it had infected him. He could not bear to risk causing the same disaster he sought to avert.

He thought of the others, of Sonic racing over the hills and plains, or fighting Robotnik, or something like that. He thought of Tails, flying around in that aeroplane - did he still have that aeroplane? He thought of... of... it was becoming so difficult to remember.

Silver's eyes lazed from side to side, his mouth slack. He tried find someone, anyone, to remember.

He blinked. There. There she was, in his mind. He thought of Blaze, exploring the world above this ruin. He thought of Blaze, living her life in a world free from primordial gods and worlds in ruin. Would she be looking for him? Would she be searching for him, still? He hoped not. He doubted it. He told no-one where he was headed. They would never know where he was.

Silver sighed in relief. In that, perhaps, he had saved the world. He would sit here in anonymity, and, whichever god willing, he would die and take the virus into the afterlife with him. They would never find him. They would never catch it from him.

Relief turned to sadness as he thought of Blaze. She would never know where he could be found.

He never had the chance to say goodbye.

Silver used his last remaining energy to shrug; it was too late now.

He sank back into his spreading folds. He had never quite felt so tired in all his life; after what he had done today, and in the future, it was hardly a surprise.

He fell asleep, into a deep, deep slumber.

1531222211222111111221221221112221121121.content:
Silver slowly blinked his eyes open; he had no idea how long he slept. He had no means of telling what time it was now.

But one thing struck him.

He was no longer in the confines of the temple. He was not in the ruins. He was not sure where he was. All about him, he could see a never-ending forest dotted by patches of wilting, yellow grass and covered in a thick blanket of yellow smog. The garden about him was overgrown with gnarled, wormy, drooping trees, their greying, oozing trunks bent double. Murky vines dripping strange, translucent fluids dangled from the branches. Strange mushrooms grew from the recesses of these trees, and he saw the familiar tubers that changed many of his friends. Apparently, they did grow like weeds.

Silver lazily gazed above the wilting tree-line to discover a house, a towering mansion that seemed to crack and decay in front of his eyes. Thick, murky smoke billowed out from dozens of chimneys. Thick, green sludge issued from the hundreds of pipes along its walls. Its entire exterior seemed to rot before his eyes - plaster yellowed and fell away. Brickwork crumbled and cracked. Wooden beams decayed and putrefied. In spite of such metamorphoses, the mansion held up as strong as ever.

Silver stared, lazily blinking at the manor - was he going to live there now? A persistent poke turned his gaze away. Looking down, he saw a curious creature. It was green, mottled and rotund, its legs hidden behind its spherical gut. Its tiny paws pressed against his hip and its yellow eyes stared up at him. Its little mouth screeched and hooted, communicating some alien language beyond Silver's faintest hopes of comprehension.

As if in answer, many more creatures of its ilk emerged from the shadows of the dying foliage; within seconds, the grass was carpeted by a numberless mass of little green men, all surrounding Silver's immobile bulk. As one, they all scampered towards him, crawling, squirming and rolling beneath his legs and belly. As one, they began to lift him, their combined efforts hoisting him into the air in spite of his massive weight. As one, they bore him along the grassy path, towards the rotting mansion. Silver could only watch in amusement as these creatures carried him. They seemed to like him to go to this much trouble for him, and they seemed friendly enough. It sure beat having to try and walk, he mused with a smile as he watched the forest pass him by. He saw more of the tubers and realised how hungry he was. No sooner had he done so than a small creature waddled up to his chest, bearing one. Grinning lazily, Silver opened his mouth, graciously receiving this offering. Chewing and swallowing the gift, Silver felt his corpulent form swell even further, all semblance of arms and legs now all but lost. If his bearers were affected by his weight gain, they gave no sign.

Before long, the forest melted away and Silver stared up at the towering maw that framed the entrance to what would become his new home. His little green bearers wasted no time in conveying him through the portal into a room that defied all dimensions. Silver blinked. He could see the walls, nor even the roof. All around him were ornate furniture pieces that were in a constant state of decay, mushrooms that burst out of the necrotic floorboards, and lights borne by clouds of flies. His eyes were drawn to the centre, even even these diseased flora gave way to brown, arid ground and blackened stumps. His relaxed expression and closed eyes only made him look more adorable, like a great big teddy bear that had somehow gone to sleep. Reaching out, she gently stroked his soft, spongy cheek.

He was so adorable.

Blaze looked back at Silver, puzzled. He didn't gain any weight while I slept, did he? she thought to herself. As she reached out for the floor, she gaped for a moment when her paw grasped at thin air. Silver, and she, were levitating.

She examined his face closely; there was no strain there. There didn't seem to be evidence of any activity save for a gentle nap.

Still got it!

Blaze jumped. Her head darted from side to side. She knew she heard Silver's voice, but the great big bed of a hedgehog had not twitched a facial muscle, let alone move his lips. What was going on?

Sorry. Couldn't... Ted to... 'f I... mind...

She looked back at his smiling, sleeping face. Telepathy, she thought, and it seemed he was just getting to grips with the basics; the second message was weaker and less distinct, like static on a radio.

She shrugged. With his new-found immobility, of course he would rely on his telekinesis! No skin off my nose, she thought, as she curled back on his warm, fluffy mane and went back to sleep.

155322.content:
Espio opened the door to the building forcefully. He'd been away from the agency for about a week due to having to train a little with his sensei, but he was looking forward to getting back on the job and earning some wages. As soon as he shut the door behind him, he noticed a small note on the noticeboard to the left. Snatching it with curiosity, Espio held it up to his face to read. It went as follows;


'Espio,
Gone away to Mighty and Ray for summer holidays. I'll be back in three months. Vector knows already, so I just wrote this for you.
Charmy'

"Well, that figures. I thought it was unusually quiet around here" Espio remarked, before crumpling the note in his hand. He tossed it into the waste basket as he walked through to the office. "Good evening Vector" he called out in no particular direction. "I have returned to resume my duties as a Chaotix member, I do hope you don't mind the overrun, the results came a little late." Slinging his bag of equipment down on the deck, Espio opened up his locker and began to file the documentation into the fire bow he owned. Following this, he took out the scrolls oout of the bag and placed them upon the top shelf where they belonged. Then, he rummaged through his weapons to put back on their hooks. He had all sorts; Shuriken, Kunai, Sai, poison darts..."Vector, are you there?"

Espio finally realised that his boss hadn't responded to him at all, nor was he anywhere to be seen. "Maybe I should leave the sorting for later..." he murmured before running full pelt around the lower floor of the agency. No matter where he looked however, there was no sign of Vector. In a flurry of concern, he dashed upstairs and checked on Vector's bedroom. "Oh no!" Espio gasped as he took a gander. There were clear signs that there had been some sort of struggle in here, the furniture looked like it had been hit by a bomb! Espio deduced that Vector had been abducted unwilling, and sighed in helplessness as he knew he couldn't do anything about it until morning. "Can't call Charmy at these late hours. Might as well get some sleep before mounting a rescue mission". He slowly made his way to his own bedroom, removing his shoes and gloves when he got there, where he climbed into bed hoping his worries weren't enough to keep him awake.

Unfortunately, as he was close to drifting off, a sharp whistling noise forced him to sit up straight, his paranoia obviously uncomfortable. "What was that?" he whispered to himself. Clambering out of bed, he grabbed a nearby torch and shined it towards the door. Seemingly, there was no one there, but that didn't stop him from being suspicious. 'I don't like this at all...oh well, I do need my rest' Espio thought, before turning around. When he did, he felt a fierce brushing on his arm. "Hey man, get that light outta my face!" a jawed figure winced before crashing to the floor. "Crocodilians! Three of them!" Espio shouted as he saw the identity of the figures that had entered his room before. He low kicked the one he'd blinded before jumping to the wall. "You must be the ones who abducted Vector, dishonourable fiends!" He climbed up the wall and grabbed a second goon with his tails. "Mmph, you're kinda heavy even for a croc. Lose some weight, please." With a powerful lash, he tossed the goon across the room and knocked him out, and gracefully fell to the floor himself. "Come to think of it, you could stand to improve the hygiene too. Now where is that third..." he managed to monologue, until he felt a sharp pain in his arm.

Espio let out a scream of agony as he felt a numb sensation spread up his arm. He spun around to face the third goon, who had managed to inject some sort of substance into his body. "We're sorry about all this, chameleon, really we are." he apologised profusely to Espio, who hissed with rage in response. "It's just that you're wanted elsewhere, and this is the easiest way to transport live goods". Espio growled, before attempting to retort. "Live goods? Do you know how disrespectful that sounds? I don't care if...I'm numb, I shall make sure...you pay dearly for...your...your..." Espio struggled, before collapsing on the floor unconscious. "It ain't no big deal chameleon, it's only tranquiliser" the goon responded before picking up Espio and hoisting him on his shoulder. Before he could move out, a shadowy feminine figure glided in, looking over the limp body of the chameleon she desired. "How touching of him to care so much about his friend! The poor dear needn't worry so much; he'll be joining him in our ranks soon enough..."

He let out a small belch afterwards and lay back on the seat. "Thank you, subject Espio." the robot answered. However, unlike the last times, it was not done at simply giving Espio the treatment. He popped out a second pill and approached Vector this time. "As both of you are at the same phase of brainwashing, it is now time for you to resume the programme, subject Vector." Vector obliged, taking the pill from the robot, placing it in his jaws and waiting for the feeding tube to automatically make its way over to him. Once it was washed down, he too lay back on the seat, content to chill with his favourite chameleon in the whole world while waiting for the pill to take effect. The robot told them that they were now...

As two more crocodilian guards entered the observation room, they could see Setella scribbling away at the coffee table, furiously writing out something important. "Your highness, s'there a problem?" asked the larger and stockier guard, as the squatter one peered with fascination. "Why yes there is. I knew I had forgotten something about all this; there will be opposition to my plight from their previous allies, and there are currently no measures in place to counteract them!" She then thrust the note into the larger guard's hand as she pulled out a device which manually controlled the dronebot by remote. "It is fortunate then that I already packed just the pills for the occasion then, is it not?" After a bit of fiddling, the device buzzed intimidatingly. "Why, the pills I installed are energy pills! When I wanted a more reliable source of energy for my machines, I commissioned my top scientists to come up with a formula that would convert any non-reptilian being into a living, brainless power cell through their methane output. What they produced was a nanoneural override transmitted via being breathed from the air in an excessive quantity!" The larger guard gasped, even though he had no idea what she meant. The smaller guard, however, recoiled in both terror and amazement as the pieces began to fit together in his head. "And since your lovers have a constant stream of gas, they can spread it to whoever they pass on their travels! How truly disgusting!" Setella smiled sweetly as she grabbed a nearby microphone, which was also remotely connected to the dronebot. "I do not think about how wonderfully horrid it would be for the insignificant rebels, guard. I save that for my treasured citizens." The guards nodded to signify that they understood, and hurried out the room. She then flicked the microphone and relayed instructions into it.

"You are now being deployed into the central urban establishment of Mobius", the drone parroted. "Once there, you are free to act as you choose towards the useless other urbanites, our workers will be able to deal with them as they arise." Espio happily squeaked at the opportunity to be left to work with Vector, while Vector himself had a question for the drone. "Hate to be pushy, butt I was told there'd be a fattening in the programme. Is that still...?" The drone moved over to the door of the brainwashing room as it replied back assuringly "That is correct, but I am afraid there has been a change in the scheduled order. It will be done once the obstacle has been overcome, do not be concerned." When the drone was finished, it turned its attention to the security panel, which is overrode with ease. On the other side of the door were a troupe of at least thirty guards, all being led by the two guards that had been with Setella. "Right blokes," the larger one began, "our dearest Setella has entrusted us in getting you two to your destined co-ordinates in complete safety. Are you completely agreeable to allow us to do this for her?" He gazed at Vector following this, who responded with an enthusiastic nod and a belch. "Okay then, and what--" he turned to Espio to say, only find that Espio was completely spaced out. The guards knew what this meant by now, so they just waited as he pushed out a small pile of waste with a beaming smile. "I...take that as a yes, then?"

1553222122122.content:
The intoxicating warmth of the sun. The soothing rippling sounds of the ocean. The feeling of soft golden sands beneath a luxurious designer towel. This is exactly why Rouge had made a beeline to this secluded spot once she found an opportunity to get some well deserved R&R. She'd been in overdrive the last few days due to a criminal ring that involved three high-status politicians, and G.U.N. had asked her to spy on one of them to gauge how much of a threat the ring was to the upcoming province elections. Now that it was all over, she simply basked on her stomach in the sunlight as her skin tanned slowly and delicately. "I should really think about what we're going to have for dinner tonight" she sighed to herself. "Can't exactly cook anything elaborate when all Shadow wants to do is recharge. Why does he even call sleep that anyway? I don't get him sometimes..." Feeling that she'd had enough time to rejuvenate her skin, she slowly edged over onto her back before sitting up. To one side was a bottle of sun lotion and some empty cans of energy drink, which she placed into her heart-shaped shoulder bag. To the other side were some chic pink shades which she opened up and placed over her eyes. "Goes with the bikini nicely, I should say!" she admired in the reflection of the water. She then lightly tapped to get the sand out from being trapped between her toes and her boot-inspired sandals before rising to her feet, ready to pack up and fly home. "Better make sure this top gal didn't forget anything!" she smirked before peering around and sorting through things. "Now let's see, I have the litter, the lotion, my purse, the towel, the parasol, the communicator, the...huh?"

She stopped rummaging to stare in the direction her sensitive ears had picked up a whirring noise, like an aircraft. Sure enough, just a couple of miles away in the sky, a large, green camo helicopter was coming into view. Rouge knew about G.U.N. flight schedule, so she wasn't expecting anything to fly while she was resting. "That doesn't look like a G.U.N. registered vehicle at all" she mused. "Whoever owns that thing must be violating countless military regulations! I guess paying them a visit wouldn't go amiss for them!" She chuckled as she dropped her bag and crept over to a nearby crevice "I'll need to wait for that thing to land before I can sneak on board though. If only Omega could see this, he'd shoot it down in seconds." The helicopter flew tentatively for a few minutes before hovering about 500 yards from where Rouge was hiding. The driver seemed incompetent to Rouge since the descent to the ground was unsteady at best, going outright unstable when it tipped over too far at times.

BANG.

The body of the helicopter suddenly made a sharp drop and hit the ground, seemingly damaging the hull somewhat. It was big enough to take the hit however. Rouge stayed in her place as she waited for personnel to come out of the craft. Sure enough, after a few minutes, about ten crocodilian soldiers marched out of the hull, all with surveying equipment. "Hey guys, y'sure this is where Setella said to let them go? I thought she wanted to spread the nano-thing, this place looks deserted!" one soldier spoke up, sipping a cold bottle of vodka after. The large guard from earlier approached him and gave him a backhander to the jaw. "We can't land a helicopter in the middle of the city, you dope! She told us to land here and then guide the secret weapons to the city. From then we can deal the damage and get us some power cells." The smaller guard also from earlier turned to the other crocs and cleared his throat. "Alright men, we have two hours to set up base here and get the weapons ready. Once they're outside, the city's stability will be on it's knees! Dismissed!" As the soldier all began to dart around and unpack various doodads to build up some sort of building structure, Rouge thought about what she'd overheard. 'Secret weapons and power cells? They're terrorists, even if they do seem awful at it! I wonder what kind of weapon it is, biohazard? Chemical warfare? What if they're nuclear bombs?!' She worried as she thought about how much damage even the lousiest of idiots could do with a nuclear bomb, but shook herself out of it to focus. "No matter what they are, I need to get in there and find them."
1553222122122.title: Relaxation Time is Over!

15532221221222.content:
Rouge wasn't known as one of the best spies in the business for giggles. With little effort, she was able to glide and hide past several croc soldiers, who were all too busy stressing over building the base in the allotted time to look out for any intruders, especially when they thought the place was desolate. "How cute, they seem like such well-behaved goody do-goods" Rouge whispered as she slinked past her twelfth witless obstacle without being seen. "Shame I can't say the same about their body odour, how gross!" She held down her gagging reflex as she finally snuck into the extremely large hull where the holding bay was. It was at least the size of two basketball courts placed together. "Sheesh, how did this thing manage to fly, and not get grounded by the military at that?" She looked around and saw various cages and crates strewn about the bay, with pumps and tubes hanging lazily from the ceiling of the hull. As she crept further in, she also noted how many vents the place had, which was strange for a vehicle like this. Edging around one of the crate stacks, she peered at two soldiers on a coffee break, eating pizza that could hardly have been called edible. Soon, she spotted a small door on the other side of the bay that none of the soldiers seemed to be using. 'I suppose that might be where our secret weapons are then. Security seems pretty lax for it' she thought as she crawled along the ceiling to her destination. She dropped down silently, using her wings to float, and drew out her pick nails to tamper with the lock on the door. With a click and a creek, the door swung open. Luckily nobody saw her as she moved through to the innards of the helicopter.

"Boy, is it sweltering in here!" Rouge gasped as the heat sharply became overpowering. "And it stinks even worse!" Bearing the torture, she powered her way through the hallway, determined to find what she was looking for. She saw more guards ahead, so she climbed into a vent and listened in on them to get some more info. "This is still as boring as it was half an hour ago!" One of the guards moaned before ripping a ripe one. Rouge grimaced upon hearing it, and the smell made it even worse. 'I do wish my nose wasn't nearly as sensitive as my ears...' "Relax bud, not long now before those guys in there are let out, then the fun really begins! I've got my eye on this little vintage brewery on the edge of the park, you should come with me!" Rouge's interest was perked by this croc's remarks. 'Those guys in there...so the secret weapons are living, breathing people? How tragic!' Quite conveniently, the lunch whistle sounded, and the two guards trotted off for more barely edible pizza and some gin cocktail shots. She knew this was her time to act. As swiftly as a deer, she dropped down from her hiding spot and ran towards the secured door. unlike the last door, there was a large steel bar across it, making just picking her way through impossible. Instead, she steadied herself as she unleashed a powerful screw kick to knock it down. It was noisy and left junk, but it did the job. Wincing slightly at the pain in her sandal-clad foot with which she had kicked the door, she fled through the door and approached the bowels of the aircraft. She could hear breathing and murmurs from inside, so she knew this was the right way. "Okay, listen fellas, I don't have much time since the guards will be back in a few minutes. You just have to co-operate and come with me and I'll make they don't cause you any harm" she spouted off as she ran through a small passage before kicking another unsecured door. "I'm an officer of G.U.N, so you know you're in safe hands with me escor...what?!"

She finally got sight the two hostages she'd come in to save, and was stunned at what she saw. Far from being a pair of helpless, weak humans as she had expected, she'd come across Vector and Espio, two men who were more than capable of fighting off these pathetic underlings. "Huh?" Vector grunted as he spotted her. "Who are you?" Rouge was shocked that Vector didn't recognise her despite having fought each other and negotiated deals in the past. "Vector, how could you not recognise me? I'm on the Chaotix hit-list constantly!" She turned her attention to Espio, who was staring at her with his head cocked to the side as he played with Vector's tail. "Espio, knock some sense into your boss! You must recognise me, I'm one of your biggest rivals!" Espio pouted in confusion before blissfully sticking his tongue out at her, annoying Rouge. "Great, they must have messed with your heads someone, and stored you in this hellhole of waste..." Vector jerked up suddenly and began to space out. Espio stopped playing with the tail and backed off, letting it stiffen up. "Speaking of waste, lady, I think Vector wants to do another dump!" Rouge stammered, partially at what she'd just been told and partially at how frank Espio was about it. Before she could ponder it further, she watched in horror as Vector ripped an extremely thick and smelly fart which allowed his mass to follow through. She couldn't help but breathe the stench in, she was too unsettled to cover her nose and mouth. Espio grinned at his pal, before turning to the womanly stranger and commenting "Smell that? Ain't he just the best at letting it loose?" This was too much for Rouge as she screamed in disgust. The guards from down the hallway could easily hear it, and came charging towards them at a rapid pace. Rouge, counting her losses. decided to save herself and leave the two Chaotix reptiles to enjoy their filth. "It looks like they don't want to hurt you, so I can come back for you some other time." She ran full pelt, kicking down the guards as she went. Unbeknownst to her, one of the guards had placed a tracker on her before she totalled him, so she could be 'collected' at a later time. Nonetheless, she fought her way through the forces and out of the helicopter, deciding to fly to the city in desperation.
15532221221222.title: Uncovering What We Already Knew

155322212212221.content:
"That's the third one that hasn't seen Rouge, Omega! Where on Mobius is she?" Shadow vented as he exited from the bar. Rouge was supposed to have been back at her place before now, so he assumed she had gone to get a small glass of tipple on her way. However, he was having no luck in finding her at her favourite hang outs. Omega was nearing the end of his analytical judgments, which left them perplexed and without a single clue as to where in the city she could possibly be. "There is another theory in my databanks." Omega asserted as Shadow lowered his head forlornly. "The location of Rouge before she was due to pass through the city was the Emerald Beach." Shadow perked his ears and glanced sideways to Omega thoughtfully. "So you're suggesting that we can find her if we head there to search?" "Affirmative" Shadow liked this suggestion, so he motioned for Omega to follow him, and they both charged down the packed streets towards the beach. Pedestrians squealed and shouted as they charged through without a second thought about their well-being, their minds had only one objective right now.

When they got to Emerald Beach, they interrogated the people there on what they knew about Rouge's whereabouts. While none of them had seen her, some did suggest that she may have been in the unused part of the beach away from everyone. After questioning about sixty people, Shadow heard a little boy crying, and pin-pointed the source to a fast food vending cart. As he approached, the mother saw him coming and begged him to assist. "Please Shadow, he wanted to buy a cheeseburger but the vendor was bought out completely by what can only be described as a possessed bat! He idolises you, so maybe he'd calm down if you spoke to him." Shadow wouldn't usually take requests like this, but the mention of a possessed bat made him concerned for Rouge's safety. "Alright madam, I'll talk to him. Omega, you ask the vendor if he knows where the bat was heading!" Shadow proceeded to assure the boy that he could get just as good a meal through home cooking before he departed their company and spoke to Omega again. "Well?" "The vendor is not certain, but he said Rouge headed in the direction of the back alley slums." Shadow exhaled heavily before looking towards said direction. "That place is hardly visited by anyone, she must be trying to do something in secret. Come on, we have to hurry!"

Looking around the main path of the slums, he could see nothing but stacks of thrown out garbage everywhere. "Rouge hiding in here is illogical" Omega stated while incinerating more stuff. "Mind keeping that to a minimum, Omega? Burning refuse doesn't smell very pleasant at all." Shadow whined. He was throwing aside pile after pile, having no luck in finding any clues on their goal. As another one fell to the ground, he could have sworn that it moaned. Still, he ignored it and moved to the other side. He kept digging through when a another pile fell and spread away, reveal a side path. Curious, Shadow cautiously walked down the path, with Omega following suit not long after. Shadow noticed there was a turning and absent-mindedly drifted to the right, oblivious to the rats that were scuttering about. His eyes still shut, he picked up a peculiar scent. "That smells like...junk food grease and awful cabbage" he concluded, before continuing on. "You know, Rouge was supposed to have been at a fast food vendor, so maybe the smell comes from that..." He opened his eyes after he'd fully turned the corner, only to be greeted by a blockade. Only, it wasn't a typical blockage, it was...

"Rouge!" both Shadow and Omega exclaimed. The once petite seductress now dwarfed the alleyway with her fat, her belly alone must have been about 5ft in diameter. She had various sauces and grease scattered all over her front, and drool coming down to form a pool of saliva between her breasts. That smell of cabbage, it was also noticed, was not coming from the various remains of packaging that the food had come in, but from Rouge's constant farts. They couldn't actually tell if it was a lot of farts or one fart that was appearing to last forever. Either way, Shadow was appalled at what he saw. "Omega, take an analysis of her. Rouge, what happened? Who did this?" Shadow's voiced was close to cracking under the stress, so he quizzed Rouge out of desperation. To his chagrin, Rouge only responded with a low and brainless moan. "No, she's completely mindless!" He snarled in anger, wanting revenge on whoever had made her this way. "Her metabolism has also been reduced to a very low level. This could be the cause of her sudden change of figure." Shadow stood perplexed at what to do with her, she was far too stuck to move her by hand. "Omega, get a Chaos Emerald out. I think I might be able to use Chaos Control if I grab her up top and concentrate hard en--HEY!"

Out of nowhere, a huge steel pincer snaked over Rouge and grabbed at her waist. Shadow, now at wit's end, made a desperate lunge at Rouge, hoping that he could someone keep her pinned down. Omega rushed forward to help him out, but it was a vein effort as she was finally yanked from her spot, damaging the two walls she had been wedged between. Shadow and Omega shouted in panic as they were hoisted with her 20ft into the air, then flung into the back of a waiting convoy. Before they could get over their dazed state, the back door slammed shut, looking much like a cattle transport in that state. the two crocs in the front of the truck gloated over their success. "Wow, her highness sure does know how to make the best plans!" chirped the younger one wearing a brown newsie cap. The older of the two, sporting a large chin and a farmer's cap, pulled the throttle as he was about to drive off. "Yesiree boy, at this rate, Setella will have her new battery system up and running in no time!"

As Elise awoke from her sleep the next day, she felt an odd sensation in her abdominal area. The princess clutched her belly with her hands and called a servant to prepare her breakfast. Elise told her that she didn't care what food was given to her, as long as it was a lot. After 20 minutes, she returned with trays full of sweet pastries and a gallon of milk. Elise lit up with joy at the sight of it all and drooled as she had to make the nigh-impossible choice of what to eat first. The cookies – chocolate chip, Oreos, snicker doodles, etc. – were at a perfect balance between being too soft and too hard. The pies, be it pumpkin, blueberry, or chocolate, were at just the right temperature, no burns or chars. The myriad cakes, regardless of their being rectangular, domed, or circular, were delicately decorated in multi-colored frosting. The cinnamon rolls were glazed in sweet sugar and the croissants were fluffy and soft. The milk was heated to the point of steaming. Perfect for the cookies, Elise thought, so she decided to go for that first. Grabbing the pitcher of milk, she hoisted it up to her mouth and began guzzling the contents down her throat. The servant Carol could only stare in a mix of awe and disgust as the milk dripped down Elise’s face. The princess gradually tipped the pitcher at an increasingly steeper angle, hoping to speed up the rate at which the milk was rushing into her mouth. However, as the pitcher’s bottom reached a horizontal apex, the remaining cow juice splashed all over Elise’s head. Her hair and clothes were totally doused and parts of her bed sheets were soaked as well.

“Princess, are you alright?” Carol asked, dashing to face her.

There was dead silence, save for the ever-growing volume of Elise’s gurgling gut. Apparently, she’d consumed too much milk in one sitting, for once again her tummy was being cradled in pain. The servant tried to support her, but would soon regret doing so. Elise’s belly began to expand, brought on by the multiplying air bubbles just begging to escape; a wish that would quickly be granted. The royal figure’s cheeks ballooned as her pent up gas forced itself into her mouth. Her strained appearance filled Carol with an even greater sense of dread.

“Princess Elise, please say something!” The servant begged.

~*BBBBUUURRRRRRRPP!*~

The wave of gas that penetrated Elise’s lips commenced an assault on Carol’s senses. It reeked of partially digested milk and made her become green in the face. She tried plugging her nose, but this left her ear open for attack. The belch rang through Carol’s eardrums, threatening to deafen her. It mattered not which body part took the brunt of the force, as Carol was going to suffer somehow at the hands of this near demonic eructation. Finally, after five long seconds, Elise’s burp had concluded, though that was five seconds too long as far as Carol was concerned. The embarrassed princess instantly slapped a gloved hand to her mouth, donning a crimson shade on her cheeks.

“Oh my, excuse me, Carol.” She said.

There were a number of things racing through the wide-eyed servant girl’s mind right now. In the span of three minutes, the leader of her kingdom had ordered a feast’s worth of food, chug half a gallon of milk, and let out an ungodly belch in her face. Oddly enough though, the thing that surprised her most was that Elise apologized for it. This girl who’d spent the last month gorging on food and breaking wind regardless of the venue just said ‘excuse me’. What was different this time? Was it because this came out the other end? Should there really have been another standard for burping instead of farting? Carol was over thinking this. It was probably just a one-time thing anyway, so there was no real reason to worry.

“It’s quite alright, your majesty, although I’m surprised that you excused yourself, given your indifference toward releasing your gas from… the other end.”

Carol was now the one blushing, mentally kicking herself for flat out asking her boss such a weird question. What right did she have to know how another reacts to their bodily emissions? To her surprise though, the princess was rather casual about it.

“Of course, I did. I may not care about my constant flatulence, but I find belching to be too rude to do around others. It’d be nearly impossible to cover up if say, I were at a social event.” Elise explained.

“Oh, well I won’t mind it if you burp like that again, as long as I’m not at ground zero when it happens.” Carol joked with a giggle.

“Hehehehe, thank you, Carol. Now I’m going to continue to enjoy my breakfast.” Elise declared.

“Yes, your highness.” Carol replied with a small bow.

Elise then turned to her food and rubbed her hands together in anticipation.
